Package scenegraph.util

Class VisualHelp

  • java.lang.Object
    • scenegraph.util.VisualHelp
  • public class VisualHelp
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of visualization helper functions, e.g. floor grid with coordinate axes, animation path drawing
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ursula Derichs

      • makeGrid

        public static Group makeGrid​(Group world,
                             int noGrids,
                             float scale)
        Generates a grey transparent floor grid with red x-Axis and blue z-Axis.
        Parameters:
        world - the group for which the grid is generated.
        noGrids - the number of vertical and horizontal lines of the grid.
        Returns:
        the new world group (which includes the grid)

      • makeGrid

        public static Group makeGrid​(Group world,
                             int noGrids)

      • makeTimeGrid

        public static Group makeTimeGrid​(Group world,
                                 int framerate,
                                 int seconds)
        Generates a time grid on the screen. The main purpose is to visualize the frame rendering at fixed and varying frame periods. Each vertical line represents one second. The horizontal lines represent the frames per seconds. Assuming you have a framerate of 25 FPS and you would like to observe at which rate your frames are rendered within 10 seconds, the grid would have 10 horizontal lines and 25+1 vertical lines. With markTimeOnGrid() the actual time would be symbolized by small red dot on the grid. When the 10 seconds are over, the new times will be displayed starting again from the top line (after the old time points have been deleted).
        Parameters:
        world - the group where the time grid is attached to
        framerate - currently used framerate
        seconds - number of horizontal lines that represent seconds
        Returns:
        the world group including the time grid

      • markTimeOnGrid

        public static void markTimeOnGrid​(float time)
        Calculates the position of specified on the grid. A small red dot (sphere) is produced to mark that time on the grid.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time, which should me marked on the grid

      • makePath

        public static Group makePath​(Group world,
                             FunctionR1Vec3 func,
                             float min,
                             float max,
                             Vec3 pathCol)
        Draws a function path/curve in the interval [, ] in the specified color.
        Parameters:
        world - Group to which path is to be added
        func - function to be drawn
        min - starting point of curve
        max - end point of curve
        pathCol - color for the path
        Returns:
        group containing the curve

      • makePath

        public static Group makePath​(Group world,
                             FunctionR1Vec3 func)
        Convenience function for makePath with some defaults. Draws a function path/curve in the interval [-100, 100] in orange color.
        Parameters:
        world - Group to which path is to be added
        func - function to be drawn
        Returns:
        group containing the curve
